title: So, is fiddlesticks really a scarecrow in the new lore?
body: Or is he a reanimated corpse covered in rags?  Is there flesh and bone left or is he full wood and cloth? Just wondering since he is confirmed for vgu and i dont want my favourite scarecrow to be turned into a zombie.

replies.body: They've not touched Fiddlesticks in the lore, so none of your concerns are even remotely on the table. He's not even confirmed for a VGU, we only have Irelia and Akali who are confirmed, and Nunu who is all but outright confirmed.

Fiddlesticks did get a lore update because his release origins of an unknown terror summoned by an apprentice summoner at the Institute of War is no longer canon. It's disappointing because it was far creepier and less stereotypical than his new lore.
Eh his old lore had so many gaps and holes that didn't make sense. I'm sure his lore will be much better when we get more than a paragraph of lore.
Arakadia gets it. ;-P

Reav3 confirmed fiddlesticks among the tier 1 vgu champions after irelia and akali, and in his updated lore he used to be human , got killed then reanimated by crows, so in the new lore he isnt really a scarecrow but more of a zombie.
Yeah, and Rakan implied Swain was part Vastaya, and we see how that turned out.
Rakan doesn't work here anymore. His attention span was too short.
That's a nice funny joke, but that does nothing to help assuage the disappointment expressed by the previous comment, or to make us trust that Riot's Narrative direction is a solid one...

Rakan is likely just unaware of what's really happening with swain. Misunderstandings happen, you know. Odds are he took one look at the guy with a glowing arm and a shapeshifter ability that gave some animal features and thought Vastayan.

That's a nice and convincing in-universe explanation, but still... "that does nothing to help assuage the disappointment expressed by the previous comment, or to make us trust that Riot's Narrative direction is a solid one..."

The point is not to explain that isolated line from a single Champ, it's why are we fed contradicting information from many different sources, and when the hell can we expect some consistency in the lore?

There are multiple sides to every story. Unless you want an obvious good vs. evil plot (besides the Void, obviously) you'll have to live with contradicting statements because no two people see an event the same way.

Oh for fuck's sake, spare me your clichés... I agree with your previous statement, but it is absolutely irrelevant to the discussion at hand and the point I'm trying to make.

Having contradicting information because of different viewpoints and unreliable narrators is NOT the same thing as having contradicting information because Narrative changed their mind. And readers are smart enough to know the difference.

So why is this Rakan line here, hmm? Because of different viewpoints, really? In the entry point of the Lore, the only thing you can be sure most players will be exposed to? The thing that should clearly convey the very basics of the characters and their dynamics? I highly doubt that's the case, and if it is, I think it's a misguided decision. You want subtleties in the longer form stories, not in the one-liners that someone will hear by happenstance as their only source of information if they don't dig deeper.

But what Scathlocke does, when a player points that out? He tells a joke. Well sorry, but from someone who made the community such big promises, while dismissing all the previous promises made as not made by him personally, I expect more than jokes when a serious issue relevant to his discipline is raised. I'm not gonna berate Sparkle or Katey when they post memes in GD, but when the **"Lead Narrative Editor"** post jokes in **Story & Art**, that's a different story altogether. 

When you talk big, you need to back it up. And I'm still waiting for that second part.

Jeez, why so much hostility? I gave my stance on it, you don't need to get angry. You can explain your side without acting like this. And Riot can tell jokes, man. A bit of thinking can come up with a reasonable explanation to this whole situation. 

You want everything laid out crystal clear? Then half the champs will lose a bunch of lines because now one side has to be picked as the correct one and that means any misconceptions a champion could have is thrown out the window. That then means you're not really seeing a champion's perspective. Maybe the lore team made a mistake, but they can work around that or even use it.

> Jeez, why so much hostility?

Because I raise a valid concern and you serve me platitudes.

> You can explain your side without acting like this.

I did. This was my 3rd post you find "too hostile". So why didn't you get it the first 2 times?

> You want everything laid out crystal clear? Then half the champs will lose a bunch of lines

Pfff, as if. Can you give me another line in a VO that gives outright false information? We have a few mysteries, some ambiguous references, but nothing is outright false, far as I can tell. I'll grant you I may have missed a couple exceptions, but mostly, the facts fed by VOs are accurate. There is much more than enough room in feelings and relationships to get depth in VOs without providing wrong facts. So don't pretend I'm arguing to remove a significant "bunch of lines".

> any misconceptions a champion could have is thrown out the window.

They are not "thrown out the window", they are relegated to more long-form and elaborated media, that can do them justice and not mislead the majority of the player base.

> Maybe the lore team made a mistake, but they can work around that or even use it.

Well, maybe they didn't even make a mistake at all. Maybe Rakan is referencing something else than the demonic powers Swain got from his pact in Noxus. The problem here is that Scathlocke didn't came and profess caution, he didn't tell us to not read too much in a VO line. He treated the statement by Oleandervine as true, and proceeded to make a joke about it. So yeah, "Riot can tell jokes". But there is being aware of context and able to read the mood. Did you miss that part of my previous post: "I'm not gonna berate Sparkle or Katey when they post memes in GD, but when the "Lead Narrative Editor" post jokes in Story & Art, that's a different story altogether."

I didn't say you were hostile in your first two comments, It was when you started getting angry that I said you were. And I tried to give you actual responses, if you want to dismiss those as platitudes I can't stop you, but I could just say the same about your argument because dismissing the opposing argument adds nothing.

Champs can lose a lot of character if any misconceptions they have are left only to long term stories, though. The way I understand it, correct me if I'm wrong on this, is that if a character thinks another character killed someone, but that character didn't, that couldn't come up in the dialogue because it would be misleading. 

I think you're the one who misread the mood. Unless I read it entirely wrong, Oleandervine was making the comment in a joking matter, and Scathlocke basically backed it up in a similar manner. The story art and sound page isn't some end all be all serious place, people can still make jokes here. You might be taking all this a bit too seriously.

> The way I understand it, correct me if I'm wrong on this, is that if a character thinks another character killed someone, but that character didn't, that couldn't come up in the dialogue because it would be misleading. 

Yeah, I see where you are going with that. Du Couteau's murder. Except that's alluded to, but never explicitly mentioned. Not who did it, at least. And even after a potential rework (since most of the champs involved have minimal VO), it doesn't need to. You can show Katarina's anger towards Swain, she can talk about revenge, she can call Swain a traitor, there are tons of way to make a good VO without ever mentioning "Swain killed my father (or at least I think so)".

And I'm not preaching for the way I'd like things to be done. I'm saying they are already done this way. Again, can you point me at a lot of dialogues with clearly contradictory facts? Where a Champ claims A, and their Rival claims B? I don't think so. And it's logical, you don't want to give players some alternative facts just for them to learn it was all a lie when they go and dig deeper (in "long-form media", not in "long term stories", 'cause that's not what I wrote).

So why this Rakan line? We can find tons of plausible in-universe explanations, sure. But what I think happened is that earlier in Swain rework, he was supposed to get his powers from a bond or pact or whatever with Vastayans, possibly after being betrayed by the previous leadership during the Ionia invasion. This was alluded to in Rakan's VO, but finally it was decided Swain powers were demonic, and it was too late to change the VO.

I'd very much like to be wrong, I swear, and that it's not yet another sign that Riot don't know where they're headed with their lore. But still, right now, that's what I fear happened. And as I said in my original comment, when a player is pointing that contradiction and Scathlocke answers with a joke, however nice, that's not reassuring.

> I think you're the one who misread the mood. [...]

Maybe. Still, you paint me as an angry no-fun-allowed idiot who doesn't understand how storytelling works, and that irks me a little. Well, you got the angry part right, at least, but it's only because you caused it yourself. I'm not saying people can't joke or that this sub-board must be the most serious place ever. But Scathlocke is one of the top guys in Narrative. He's one of the two people responsible for the overall quality and consistency of the Lore. It's his job and his responsibility, very specifically, to make sure the lore is "Good (tm)". So **people** can make jokes, but it's not **his** place to make a joke when someone points an issue.
Meddler or Katey or Sparkle also make jokes and memes and funny comments. But Meddler doesn't come and make them in a thread where someone is complaining about Voli being OP this patch, or Katey when someone's angry because they couldn't see the VFX of the latest skin and lost their game because of that. You know, because solving those problems is part of their job.
Is it really that hard to see the parallel I'm drawing here? That looked pretty damn simple to me, which is why my first comment was a one-liner, but you keep subtly misinterpreting everything I say, so this one became a fucking wall of text.
Birdbrains and all.
